dialogue.raw_text: Tell me about it. I used to play in a really tight band back when I lived in Chicago, and one night we opened for the Melvins... do you know who the Melvins are?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (lying) Yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, we were playing with them and I busted this guitar onstage. It cost me $800 and a dime bag just to have it fixed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When was this, like '96?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . I'm telling you that was the best time for rock and roll.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nuh-uh, 1977! Punk Volume 1. You weren't there, so you can't understand the magic.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You weren't even alive!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Vanessa, Mac and Gerta Rauss are waiting in awkward silence for Juno and Mark to return. Mac notices a brand new PILATES MACHINE sitting in its packaging in a corner of the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So. What's that thing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pilates machine?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you make with that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't make anything. It's for exercising.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Mark and Juno tool around on the guitars unplugged. They play little riffs. He teaches her a couple chords.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My wife just ordered one of those Tony Little Gazelles off the TV, you know, from the guy with the ponytail? Vanessa and Gerta have no response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly, a shriek of AMP FEEDBACK, followed by loud, discordant GUITAR STRUMMING can be heard drifting down from upstairs. Vanessa's looks to the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That guy just doesn't look right to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to her guests) Will you excuse me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Mark has strapped on the Les Paul and is playing and singing. "Doll Parts" by Hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Building together.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly singing together) "Yeah, they really want you... they really want you... they really do."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (singing together and connecting) Yeah, they really want you... they really want you... and I do to. (both blush)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: appears in the doorway. Juno immediately puts down the guitar. Mark doesn't notice her immediately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark clumsily puts down the guitar and stands up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark hangs the guitars back on the wall. He and Juno exit the room, chastised. Vanessa looks to Mark in question.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (passionate singing)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... (notices Vanessa) Oh, sorry honey...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You guys are playing music?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Juno just wanted a closer look at Kimber here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your guitar is named Kimber?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's all right. My axe is named Roosevelt. After Franklin, not Ted. Franklin was the hot one with the polio.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think Gerta is waiting for us downstairs with some important stuff for us to go over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Didn't mean to interrupt the jam sessions.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Juno and Mac have put their coats on and are in the process of leaving. Gerta hands Juno the DOCUMENTS. Vanessa and Mark trail behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mac STARES at Juno gravely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno looks at Mark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark seems visibly embarrassed by Vanessa's manic demeanor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno and Mac exit. Mark shuts the door. All is silent in the foyer. Mark, Vanessa and Gerta stand motionless. Gerta pumps her fist triumphantly, trying to create a mood of celebration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vanessa buries her head in her hands and weeps hoarsely.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So, look those over and give me a call at my office if you have any questions.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Juno, we'd really appreciate it if you could keep us updated on any doctor's appointments, ultrasounds, other things of that nature.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh. Sure. Of course you'd want to know how your kid is cooking.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So, then, you really think you're going to go ahead with this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. For sure. I like you guys.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How sure? Percentage-wise, would you say you're 80% sure, 90% sure?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm going to say I'm 104% sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh really?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, if I could give it to you now, I would. But it probably looks like a Sea Monkey at this point, so I think we should leave it in there for a while until it gets cuter, you know?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think that's a great idea.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's great, right? Stellar news. Well, you guys drive safe, and we'll hear from you soon, all right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, take care of yourselves.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (overly aggressive) All RIGHT!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It is now WINTER. The TRACK TEAM jogs in formation, leaving tracks in the snow. Those bastards never stop running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bleeker is running alone on the track. His exhalations are icy puffs in the air. Bleeker's friend VIJAY jogs up alongside him. Vijay is a solemn, skinny boy, much like Bleeker.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, hey Vijay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you hear Juno MacGuff is pregnant?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yup.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just like our moms and teachers!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yup.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you hear it's yours?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yup.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What a trip, man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't really know anything about it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You should grow a moustache. You're a real man now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't grow a moustache. It never comes in evenly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Me neither. But I'm going to stop wearing underpants in order to raise my sperm count. See you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: jogs off. Bleeker STOPS and wipes away his sweat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're looking over Juno's now FIVE MONTH PREGNANT BELLY to a school administrator filling out a slip. Juno takes the slip, turns around and smiles all the way out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno exits the head office and bumps into Bleeker.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey Juno... A couple of us are going to the cineplex after school to donut that movie with the guy with eighteen kids.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry, Bleek... Going for my ultrasound. Gotta note and everything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, cool.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll try to drop by later.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ! We see ultrasound goo being squirted onto Juno's exposed pregnant belly. An ULTRASOUND TECHNICIAN is using a Doppler device to view the contents of her burgeoning bump. Bren and Leah ooh and ahh at the resulting image. The tech takes measurements and types them into her database.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The monitor reveals the baby's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno and Leah look at BREN, who is dabbing her eyes discreetly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno, Leah and Bren become immediately defensive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bren gestures to the ULTRASOUND MONITOR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ULTRASOUND TECH exits in a huff.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That's the feet...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oooh...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And there's a hand...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (various) Check that out... No way...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (dreamily) Would you look at that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Check out Baby Big-Head. That kid is scary!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, I'm a sacred vessel. All you've got in your belly is Taco Bell!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Touche.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (gazing at the monitor) It is really weird looking. It's like it's not even real. I can't believe there are saps who actually cry at these things.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What? I'm not made of stone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, there we have it. Would you like to know the sex?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aw, please Junebug?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No way. No, I definitely don't want to know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Planning to be surprised when you deliver?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I want Mark and Vanessa to be surprised, and if I know, I won't be able to keep myself from telling them and ruining the whole thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (condescending) Are Mark and Vanessa your friends at school?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, they're the people who are adopting the baby.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh. Well, thank goodness for that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait, what's that supposed to mean?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just see a lot of teenage mothers come through here. It's obviously a poisonous environment for a baby to be raised in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How do you know I'm so poisonous? Like, what if the adoptive parents turn out to be evil molesters?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Or stage parents!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They could be utterly negligent. Maybe they'll do a far shittier job of raising a kid than my dumbass stepdaughter ever would. Have you considered that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No... I guess not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is your job title, exactly?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Excuse me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I said, what-is-your-job-title, Missy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm an ultrasound technician, ma'am.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well I'm a nail technician, and I think we both ought to stick to what we know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you talking about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You think you're special because you get to play Picture Pages up there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My five year-old daughter could do that, and let me tell you, she is not the brightest bulb in the tanning bed. So why don't you go back to night school in Manteno and learn a real trade!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bren, you're a dick! I love it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Juno lays in bed checking out the ULTRASOUND PRINT OUT.

direction.raw_text: Juno rings the doorbell, shifting her weight in the cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: answers the door, dressed in a t-shirt and jeans.

direction.raw_text: He gestures awkwardly to Juno's belly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Juno? Wow, I didn't expect to see you here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've got something really cool to show you guys. Is Vanessa here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, she's working late tonight. She's trying to accrue some extra time off for when, you know...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right. I hear they can be kind of a time-suck.

dialogue.raw_text: Come on in. You wanna Ginseng Cooler?

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know. Something to do with the four-packs... (adding) ...They're not bad.

direction.raw_text: She holds up a manila envelope.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Why aren't you at work?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I mostly work from home. I'm a composer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No shit. Like Johannes Brahms?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, more commercial stuff.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Commercials.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have you seen those ads for Titanium Power men's deodorant?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (singing) Titanium Power! Get more snatch by the batch!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wrote that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're kind of a sellout, aren't you? What would the Melvins say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They'd say you came a long way out here not knowing if anyone would be home.

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, you're going to want to sit down for this.

direction.raw_text: Mark EXAMINES the ultrasound, baffled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark looks jolted, as if it's the first time he considered that her baby might have a father. He stands up and holds the photo up to the light critically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark chuckles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A new SONG has begun. Mark closes his eyes in ecstasy and walks toward the stereo. Juno follows him toward the source of the music, looking perplexed by how happy he is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark grabs the STEREO REMOTE off the kitchen counter and turns up the volume to a roar. Mark and Juno stand in silence in the kitchen. Mark mouths along with the lyrics.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gestures at Juno's burgeoning paunch. Mark walks over to his music collections and starts pulling CD's. He's got a Carpenter's disc, the "No Alternative" charity compilation, and Mother Love Bone. Juno spots a VHS TAPE on the coffee table and picks it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark SWIVELS AROUND slowly on his desk chair, surprised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark gives a look - "Oh, Really?"
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Park it, dude.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Behold, good sir! The very first photo of your future child.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're kidding!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think it kind of looks like my friend, Paulie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (joking) Oh, is he bald and amorphous?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, he's the dad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can you tell if it's a boy or a girl?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The doctor can tell, but I decided not to know. I want it to be a big surprise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, it can really only go two ways.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what you think. I drink tons of booze so you might get one of those scary neuter-babies that's born without junk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Junk?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know... it's parts...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know what junk is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (teasing) Yeah?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We definitely want it to have junk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well don't worry about it. My stepmom is forcing me to eat really healthy. She won't even let me stand in front of the microwave or eat red M&Ms. Hope you're ready.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait...do you hear that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's only my favorite song. It's Sonic Youth doing "Superstar" by the Carpenters.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (excited) I've heard the Carpenters before. Chick drummer and freaky dude. Not unlike the White Stripes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You haven't heard the Carpenters like this. Listen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (lipsynching) Don't you remember you told me you loved me, baby...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, I like this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This album is all Carpenters covers by alt-rock bands. It's called If I Were a Carpenter. It is God. I'll rip a copy for you before you leave.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't have to do that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's the least I can do. What did you say your favorite band was?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't. But it's a three-way tie between the Stooges, Patti Smith and the Runaways.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, I definitely need to make you some CDs. At least while my kid is hanging out in there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (reading title) The Wizard of Gore?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (distracted) Oh yeah. It's Herschel Gordon Lewis. He's the ultimate master of horror.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please. Dario Argento is the ultimate master of horror.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Argento's good, but Lewis is completely demented. We're talking buckets of goo. Red corn syrup everywhere. And fake brains up the yin-yang.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (examining the tape box) Frankly, this looks kind of stupid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We see some particularly memorable footage from The Wizard of Gore. Mark and Juno are watching the movie and drinking root beer floats. They're sitting dangerously close on the sofa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He raises his mug in a toast and Juno clinks it awkwardly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A door suddenly slams upstairs. Vanessa's home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno jumps up and rushes out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (watching movie) This is even better than Suspiria. You've got decent taste in slasher movies, Mark.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Here's to dovetailing interests.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So, have you and Vanessa thought of a name for the baby yet?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, sort of. Vanessa likes Madison for a girl.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (aghast) Madison? Isn't that kind of... I don't know, gay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: God, pretentious much? I guess everyone should have a mysterious name like Juno, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My dad went through this phase where he was obsessed with Greek and Roman mythology. He named me after Zeus's wife. I mean, Zeus had other lays, but I'm pretty sure Juno was his only wife. She was supposed to be really beautiful but really mean. Like Diana Ross.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That suits you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh, thanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, not many teenage girls in your situation would actually go through with this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I weighed my options. But after all this, I'm glad I didn't, you know, get rid of it. I want to have it. For you guys.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're something else.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Vanessa. Shit, you better get out of here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why? What the big deal?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing. She just hates when I sit around watching movies and 'not contributing.'
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll handle this. I'm really good at diffusing mom-type rage.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait... aww, crap!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Vanessa slides her BRIEFCASE off her shoulder and ventures into the living room. She's struggling to carry some oversized shopping bags.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno intercepts her breathlessly, clutching the ULTRASOUND photo. Mark trails behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vanessa JUMPS and makes a strangled sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vanessa is obviously entertaining some worse-case scenarios. Her eyes are wide and she's uncharacteristically ruffled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She holds the ULTRASOUND up to show Vanessa and drapes her arm around her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vanessa drops the shopping bags, sick with relief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She can't divert her gaze from the photo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vanessa chuckles tightly, clearly embarrassed by her show of emotion.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mark? Are you home? I want to show you some things I picked up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hi Vanessa!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Juno! God, you startled me. What are you doing here? What's wrong?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then what's going on?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I went to the doctor today.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is the baby okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure. It's the right size and everything. I even saw its phalanges today! Check this...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is the baby. Your baby.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh my God...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (kindly) Doesn't it look like it's waving? It's kind of like it's saying "Hi, Vanessa. Will you be my mommy?"
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. Yeah, it kind of does.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Juno was nice enough to bring this by for us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I came over as soon as I got that cold ultrasound goo off my pelvis. My stepmom verbally abused the ultrasound tech so we were escorted off the premises.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (distracted) Oh, that's great!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: See? Nothing to worry about.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ENTRY WAY - DAY Vanessa and Mark walk Juno out. Juno peers at some shopping bags from various kids stores.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno glances at Mark and again at Vanessa. Vanessa looks embarrassed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She waves and heads for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vanessa looks pain-stricken as Mark helps Juno with her bag.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, what kind of swag did you score?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. Mall madness, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh it's just some stuff I picked up. For, you know, the baby. Babies need a lot of things. I want everything to be just right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I thought people got all that stuff at baby showers. When my stepmom had my sister I remember she got about a million presents. They were all lame though, so I wasn't jealous.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I doubt anyone's throwing us a shower.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Um, I think people are kind of unsure about the situation because it's not, you know, set in stone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean? You mean... (aghast) Do you think I'm going to flake out on you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, no, I don't think that, Juno. It's just that, we went through a situation before where it didn't work out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cold feet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You should have gone to China. I heard they give away babies like free iPods. They shoot 'em out of those T-shirt guns at sports events.

dialogue.raw_text: (abruptly) Right. Well, Juno, your parents must be wondering where you are. You might want to head home.

dialogue.raw_text: Cool.

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, I have something for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Lorings' basement is dank, cluttered unfinished and unattractive, much like Paulie Bleeker's. Mark pulls a chain to illuminate a bare bulb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark RUMMAGES through a cardboard box in the corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He shows the COMIC to Juno. It's called "Most Fruitful Yuki." It depicts a pregnant JAPANESE GIRL kicking ass and taking names.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno examines the comic. "Most Fruitful Yuki" does resemble her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She throws a KARATE KICK in Mark's direction with a KEE-YA! Juno is sincerely pleased.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a battered portable CD player in the corner. Juno kneels down and pops in one of the discs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno puts in the CD and "All The Young Dudes" fills the room. Mark Laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She mockingly places her hands on Mark's waist and moves back and forth stiffly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark puts his hands on what remains of Juno's waist. She drapes her arms around his neck self-consciously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They SWAY slowly to the music. Juno's belly bumps up against Mark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They laugh. Juno rests her head on Mark's chest. They dance in silence for a few moments, then stop moving. Mark pulls Juno as close as he possibly can, given her expanding girth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno backs away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She GESTURES wildly to her belly. Suddenly, something matters to her far more than the approval of an older guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark suddenly sees Juno for what she is -- a teenage girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He paces over to the wall and KICKS it softly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno turns to leave, then shoots one furious look back at Mark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She bolts up the stairs, sobbing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Mark! Is this the baby's room? It's beautiful!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hilarious. No, I just keep all of my old comics down here, and I want to show you one of them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh God, you're one of those guys...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're gonna like this, I promise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (extracting a bagged COMIC from the box) Here it is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: "Most Fruitful Yuki"? What is... Oh my god, she's a pregnant superhero!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Isn't that great? I got it when I was in Japan with my band. She reminds me of you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wow, I actually feel like less of a fat dork now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Most Fruitful Yuki is bad ass, man. You should be proud to be the same condition.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, how about some tunes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now this first one is kinda slow. But it's Mott the Hoople so it's still totally rad and hardcore.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I actually know this one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, this song's older than me, if you can believe that. I danced to it at my senior prom.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's almost interesting, Mark. Who did you dance with?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Her name was Cynthia Vogel and she was a good dance partner. Even let me put my hands on her butt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh man, I can just picture you slow dancing like a dork!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I put my hands on your waist. Then you put your arms around my neck. That's how we did it in '88.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, okay. Like this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You've never been to a dance, have you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (casually defensive) Only squares and nerds go to dances.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I feel like there's something between us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm leaving Vanessa.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quiet at first) What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's just not working out, but I'm getting my own place in the city... and I've got it all planned out. It's something I've wanted to do for a long time...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (growing) No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. No, you definitely cannot do that, Mark. That's a big, fat sack of no!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the matter?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This isn't what we agreed on. You guys have to take care of... this! You are the chosen custodians of the big-ass bump!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But I thought you'd be cool if...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (interrupting) I want you guys to adopt the Buglet. I wanted everything to be perfect. Not shitty and broken like everyone else's family. Listen, once I have the baby, Vanessa is going to finally be happy, and everything will be all right. Believe me on this one!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A baby is not going to fix everything. Besides, I don't know if I'm ready to be a father.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (aghast) But you're old!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... How do you think of me, Juno? Why are you here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know. I just liked being your friend. I sort of liked becoming furniture in your weird life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This... (he gestures to the dank surrounding room) ...this is what my life has become. Stuff in boxes. Stuff underground. Is that so appealing to you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, I guess... Is this my fault? Is Vanessa mad at you because of me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's not the point. We're just not in love anymore.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, but didn't you love Vanessa when you married her? If you love someone once, you can love them again, I know it. My friend Leah has gone out with the same guy, like, four times. You're just not trying.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm such an idiot. I can't believe what an idiot I am.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please don't get a divorce! God, Mark, just do me a solid and stay with your wife.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: God, you're so young.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not really. I'm sixteen. I'm old enough to tell when people are acting like total a-holes!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh and by the way, I bought another Sonic Youth album and it's the worst thing I've ever heard! It's just noise, man!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Juno reaches the top of the stairs and scrambles toward the front door, only to be intercepted by Vanessa, who's returning home from work, carrying her briefcase and a freshly purchased NURSING PILLOW. They nearly collide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's obvious from Juno's tears and flushed face that she's lying. Vanessa instantly goes pale with fear, but she tries her hardest to seem serene and "together" in front of Juno.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She rushes toward the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno halts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno looks totally betrayed. She doesn't respond. Vanessa looks at Juno's expression and knows Mark is lying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She knows exactly to what he's referring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno's face continues to fall. Vanessa notices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno ain't buying it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This stops Vanessa. Juno looks offended.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A long hideous beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another hideous beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vanessa sighs. It's done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vanessa looks defeated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We hear the front door closing. Vanessa and Mark look over and notice that Juno has escaped the conflict.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Juno? What's going on?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pretending to be calm) Mark? Why is Juno crying?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not crying. I'm allergic to fine home furnishings. See you later.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hold on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Juno, what's the matter?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's hormonal. Right, June? It's just part of the whole process.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What did you do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't do anything... I just... I've just been thinking.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (you've been thinking?) What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just thinking if this is really the right thing for us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you referring to?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've been just wondering if we're, you know, ready.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course we're ready. We've taken all the classes. The nursery. The books -- MARK I know we're prepared. I just don't know if... I'm ready.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Juno) Juno, don't worry about this. He just has cold feet. That's how boys are. The books all say the same thing. A woman becomes a mother when she gets pregnant. A man becomes a father when he sees his baby. He's going to get there. He'll get there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Mark) Why don't we let Juno go home and we can discuss this later on, okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It all just happened so fast. We put that ad in the paper. I thought it would take months if, you know, ever and then -- boom -- Two weeks later, she's in our living room.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) She answered our prayers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (ignores the comment) Ever since, it's just been like a ticking clock.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you saying?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It just feels a little like bad timing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What would be a good time for you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know. There's just things I still want to do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like what? Be a rock star?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't mock me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're trying to do something that's never going to happen. And you know what? Your shirt is stupid. Grow up. If I have to wait for you to become Kurt Cobain, I'm never going to be a mother.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I never said I'd be a great father.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Juno runs up to her car sobbing. She struggles with the keys, but finally makes it into the Previa and drives off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Previa slides off the road and comes to a stop on the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno buckles over the steering wheel, crying, unwinding for the first time since she became pregnant. After a beat, she begins to gather herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bleeker is sitting next to his bed, noodling on the guitar. He's playing a theme that we will soon recognise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno lays on the hood of her Previa, contemplating her future. We push in close... when she gets an idea. She hops off the hood and scurries into the Previa where she finds a crumpled up Jiffy Lube receipt. She unfolds it and pulls out a pen, ready to write something... a note?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's quiet after the storm. Inside, we see Vanessa sitting alone at her perfect dining room table, drinking a glass of wine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vanessa takes a sip and continues to let the days events sink in. After a beat, Mark comes down the stairs to join her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mark nods and sits down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They STARE at the wall, speechless and defeated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She buries her head in her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a LOUD KNOCK on the front door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I called Gerta Rauss. She says she can represent both of us. They call it "collaborative divorce." It's apparently all the rage right now. And it's easy because we don't have children.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, it's fine. Thanks for making the call, I guess.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're actually, finally doing this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Looks like it, yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have you found a place to stay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, downtown.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A hotel?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a loft.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (lightly teasing) Aren't you the cool guy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wanted a baby so bad. So bad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know you did.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Mark opens the door. There's a folded piece of paper sitting on the doormat. He squints and sees Juno pulling away in the van. Mark carefully unfolds the piece of paper -- it takes a minute because of Juno's proficiency in "teen girl origami." He holds it up. We can see there's WRITING on the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vanessa takes the note from his hand and turns it over, examining it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It looks like a bill from Jiffy-Lube.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Juno parks her car and walks up to her house. A porch light's been left on for her, and the place looks cozy and inviting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She picks a CROCUS from the unkempt garden near the porch and sniffs it. She lifts her shirt and tickles her belly with it. Then she tucks the flower into her unkempt hair.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I never realize how much I like being home unless I've been somewhere really different for a while.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Mac is alone at the kitchen table going over the family finances while drinking one of Bren's weight loss shakes. Juno enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno nods in agreement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A wave of REALIZATION crosses Juno's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He nods toward her belly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno laughs and hugs her father, planting a smooch on his cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She salutes and dashes out of the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hi Dad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, big puffy version of Junebug. Where have you been?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dealing with stuff way beyond my maturity level. Where is everyone?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bren took Liberty Bell to her tot ice skating class.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tot ice skating? Tots can't ice skate. Liberty Bell's still getting the hang of stairs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, but you know Bren. She dreams big.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, she does.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You look a little morose, honey. What's eating you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm losing my faith in humanity.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Think you can narrow it down for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I guess I wonder sometimes if people ever stay together for good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You mean like couples?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, like people in love.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you having boy trouble? I gotta be honest; I don't much approve of you dating in your condition, 'cause... well, that's kind of messed up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dad, no!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, it's kind of skanky. Isn't that what you girls call it? Skanky? Skeevy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please stop now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (persisting) Tore up from the floor up?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dad, it's not about that. I just need to know that it's possible for two people to stay happy together forever. Or at least for a few years.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not easy, that's for sure. Now, I may not have the best track record in the world, but I have been with your stepmother for ten years now, and I'm proud to say that we're very happy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In my opinion, the best thing you can do is to find a person who loves you for exactly what you are. Good mood, bad mood, ugly, pretty, handsome, what have you, the right person will still think that the sun shines out your ass. That's the kind of person that's worth sticking with.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I sort of already have.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, of course. Your old D-A-D! You know I'll always be there to love and support you, no matter what kind of pickle you're in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Obviously.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I need to go out somewhere for just a little while. I don't have any homework, and I swear I'll be back by ten.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You were talking about me, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We push in over Bleeker sleeping in his car-bed towards the window. We look out onto the lawn to find Juno and Leah running back to the Previa, hopping in, and screeching off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bleeker steps out of the house for his usual early-morning run. He looks down to see a message scrawled in chalk on the stoop: "BLEEKER -- CHECK THE MAIL." He walks down to the end of the driveway and opens the latch on the mailbox. At least one hundred containers of ORANGE TIC TACS come pouring out in an colorful deluge. They spill out onto the driveway. Bleeker smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno waddles toward the field. The guys on the track team, ridiculously arrayed as usual, are doing hurdler stretches. They stare at her quizzically. Bleeker spots Juno approaching and jogs up to the chainlink fence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno presses Bleeker's hand against her belly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bleeker and Juno KISS, oblivious to the gawking track team guys in the background. In the distance, near the school entrance, we see STEVE RENDAZO (the kid who always TORMENTS Juno) regarding the makeout session with a sad, envious expression.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Did you put like a hundred things of Tic Tacs in my mailbox?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. That was me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (blushes) Because they're your fave. And you can never have too much of your favorite one-calorie breath mint.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well... thanks. I think I'm pretty much set until college on the Tic Tac front.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, I've been thinking. I'm really sorry I was such a huge bitch to you. You didn't deserve that. You never deserve any of the poo I unload on you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know it's okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Also, I think I'm in love with you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What, you mean as friends?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, for real. I think you are the coolest person I've ever met. And you don't even have to try.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I try really hard, actually...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, you're naturally smart. You always think of the funniest things to do. Remember when you passed me that postcard during Spanish class, and it was addressed like, "Junebug MacGuff, Row 4, Third Seat From the Blackboard"? And it said, "I'm having fun in Barcelona -- wish you were here"? That was hilarious.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was just bored. I only think school is awesome like, 80% of the time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Plus, you're the only person who doesn't stare at my stomach all the fucking time. You actually look at my face. And every time I look at you, the baby starts kicking me super hard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It does?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wizard!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think it's because my heart starts pounding when I see you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mine too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Basically, I'm completely smitten with you, and I don't care if I'm making an ass out of myself right now, because you've seen me make an ass out of myself a million times, and you still want to be my friend.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, yeah. You're the best friend I've ever had, even when you're being kind of evil.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's all I need from you. That's more than I could ever ask for. You're just golden, dude.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can we make out now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: passes by, does a double take, then hurries up to the fence, rolling her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno gives her the FINGER, not breaking the clinch with Bleeker.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (disgusted) You know, you can go into early labor sucking face like that!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Juno is lying on her back on the bed, staring at the ceiling. She's more pregnant than we've ever seen her. She revs a Matchbox car against the slope of her belly and lets it roll. Juno suddenly sits up, looking thoroughly freaked. She pats her lap frantically and jumps off the bed.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Dad!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Mac looks up from the lure he's working on.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) What?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Either I just pissed my pants or...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thundercats are go!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Mac, Bren and Liberty Bell rush out of the house. They pile into the Previa at breakneck speed. Juno waddles behind them, protesting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Juno wearing a puffy surgical cap. She's being pushed down the hospital corridor in a wheelchair. She bursts into giggles. Pull back to reveal her that Leah is pushing her rather aggressively. Leah jokingly steers the wheelchair into a wall. Juno feigns whiplash. Bren appears behind them and orders Juno out of the wheelchair, exasperated. She pulls off Juno's surgical cap. Leah and Juno snicker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see Juno is in a BIRTHING SUITE at the hospital, pacing impatiently, bent over in obvious discomfort. She's wearing her Chuck Taylors and knee socks with her hospital gown. Leah and Bren stand nearby. Juno doubles over in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno lets out a genuine shriek of pain.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (panicked) Ow, ow, fuckity-ow. Bren, when do I get that Spinal Tap thing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's called a spinal block, and you can't have it yet, honey. The doctor said you're not dilated enough.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You mean I have to wait for it to get even worse? Why can't they just give it to me now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, honey, doctors are sadists who like to play God and watch lesser people scream.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (checking her watch) Shit. (To the doctor) Hey, can we give my kid the damn spinal tap already?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) It really didn't hurt that bad having him. We see Juno in the process of delivery, from her POV. Leah holds one of Juno's feet and Bren holds the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see Leah holding Juno's FOOT, which is shaking. Leah's shirt is soaked. She rolls her eyes and mouths "Fuck you" at Juno. Juno's raised MIDDLE FINGER enters the frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The doctor reveals JUNO'S BABY BOY above the sheet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno looks at the baby in awe, then her eyes begin to flutter... and she passes out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) The best part was when I peed on Leah during labor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) And then, out of nowhere, there it was...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) There he was.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Paulie Bleeker is running as fast as his legs can carry him on the Dancing Elk track. There's a very sparse crowd in the bleachers. As Paulie approaches the tape, his envious teammate Vijay looks on. Bleeker's mom is seated near Vijay, holding a video camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paulie breaks the tape, winning the race. The fifteen or so people in attendance cheer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bleeker pants at the finish line, dripping with sweat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bleeker looks out at the BLEACHERS, scanning them for Juno. She's not there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bleek takes off RUNNING toward the parking lot without stopping to explain. His mother stands up, confused.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I decided to not call Bleeker to tell him that I was having the baby. He had a big meet against Manteno and I didn't want him to get all worried about me and choke.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (admiringly) His legs are as swift as his seed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . BLEEKER What did you say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . Bleeker has just broken a district record in the 400.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) But he figured it out anyway.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: reaches into one of the maternity ward bassinets and gently lifts up a swaddled newborn baby. The nurse turns and addresses an unseen spectator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pull back to reveal she's speaking to VANESSA, who stands, paralyzed, several feet away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vanessa reaches out for the baby and gingerly accepts him in her eyes. She spends a few moments just looking at him. She feels someone watching her, then looks up to see a Bren leaning against the doorway. Vanessa blinks away her tears self-consciously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vanessa laughs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Would you like to meet your son?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have a son?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (amused) You are the adoptive mother?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have a son.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Healthy kid, too. Didn't waste any time getting out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How do I look?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (gently) Like a mom. Scared shitless.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Juno is curled up on her bed in the birthing room. The birth is obviously over; there's that air of stillness and accomplishment, a task completed. The doctors have cleared out. Mac sits in a chair next to the bed, looking like he's not sure what to say. He holds up a deck of Playing cards as if to initiate a game, but Juno gently pushes his hand away. Their eyes meet. His expression is helpless, hers is utterly drained.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno nods and swallows. Over Mac's shoulder, a silhouette appears in the doorway. It's Bleeker in his track uniform. Juno sees him and bursts into sudden, ragged sobs. Mac glances at her, alarmed. Paulie moves toward the bed. Mac clears his throat, gets up and leaves the room. Paulie climbs onto the hospital bed and carefully puts his arm around Juno. She leans into him, letting herself go for the first time in months.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Someday, you'll be back here, honey. On your terms.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Juno lies on the bed. She looks rested and relaxed compared to her earlier crying jag, but her face is still pink and swollen. Bleeker is curled up next to her, still in his track uniform and spikes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Bleeker decided he didn't want to see the baby. Neither did I, really. He didn't feel like ours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We see Vanessa leaning over the bassinet, unable to take her eyes off the baby, touching it's hair reverently.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I think he was always hers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The nursery is perfectly decorated in Vanessa's immaculate taste. Nothing looks as though it's been touched. We see the antique ROCKING CHAIR sitting empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We pan past the wall Vanessa had said "needed something." There's a framed note on the wall. It looks like it was handwritten on the back of a Jiffy Lube bill. We see that it says: "Vanessa -- If you're still in, I'm still in. Juno." We move to the door and get a view of Vanessa's bedroom. We see her lying in bed with a burp cloth draped over her shoulder, feeding the baby. For the first time ever, Vanessa looks disorganized, unshowered -- and incredibly happy. There are formula bottles on the bedside table and a bassinet pushed close to the bed. Obviously, she hasn't been away from the baby for a single moment. The baby reaches up and grabs Vanessa's thumb. Vanessa glows with an expression of pure bliss.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) It ended with a chair.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It's a sparkling summer afternoon. Juno wheels her bicycle out of the detached garage. She waves goodbye to Bren, who is playing in the yard with two WEIMARANERS. She looks almost as happy with her dogs as VANESSA looked with her baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Juno rides her bike aggressively down the street. Her guitar is slung over her shoulder in a gig bag. She's obviously not pregnant anymore. She looks happy, but older.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As she tears recklessly down the street on her bikes, she passes the Dancing Elk TRACK TEAM, still running in outrageously skimpy shorts and bandanas. Juno RIDES up to a garage where Bleeker is sitting, tuning his guitar.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) As boyfriends go, Paulie Bleeker is totally boss. He is the cheese to my macaroni. I know people are supposed to fall in love before they reproduce, but normalcy's not really our style.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Juno bikes up to find Bleeker sitting on the stoop. She smiles and takes out her guitar. She sits across from Bleeker and pulls the pick out of the strings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bleeker nods. Juno begins strumming her guitar and playing "Anyone Else But You," by the Moldy Peaches. Bleeker joins in. At first their playing is discordant, but suddenly it works.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She and Bleeker exchange glances as they play. They smile ambiguously. Juno leans over and kisses Bleeker on the cheek. Pull out to reveal the surrounding green suburb buzzing with life and summer activity.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ready?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're a part time lover and a fulltime friend. The monkey on your back is the latest trend. I don't see what anyone can see, in anyone else but you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Here is the church and here is the steeple. We sure are cute for two ugly people. I don't see what anyone can see, in anyone else but you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We both have shiny happy fits of rage. You want more fans, I want more stage. I don't see what anyone can see, in anyone else but you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You are always trying to keep it real. I'm in love with how you feel. I don't see what anyone can see, in anyone else but you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I kiss you on the brain in the shadow of a train. I kiss you all starryeyed, my body's swinging from side to side. I don't see what anyone can see, in anyone else but you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The pebbles forgive me, the trees forgive me. So why can't you forgive me? I don't see what anyone can see, in anyone else but you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Du du du du du du dudu. Du du du du du du dudu. I don't see what anyone can see, in anyone else but you.
dialogue.name: dialogue
